title.narrative: OUTPUT 4.1: ADOLESCENTS POLICIES AND STRATEGIES

description.narrative: Policies, strategies and programmes are in place to enhance skills, capacities and resilience of vulnerable adolescents and youth, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Education â€“ General, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Adolescents have improved capacities to contribute to enhancing resilience and social cohesion in their communities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Policies, strategies and programmes are in place to enhance skills, capacities and resilience of vulnerable adolescents and youth

description.narrative: UNICEF continued supporting enabling and protective environment for and with adolescents and youth in Syria. This included the engagement of young people through youth advisory boards in seven governorates; participatory action research by and for young people in two governorates; and undertaking an Assessment of the Technical and Vocational Education and Training (TVET) System together with young people. UNICEF built the capacity of 1,096 service providers and youth workers to enhance the quality of services and upgraded the Life Skills and Citizenship Education Manual and its monitoring tools to meet the needs of young people. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2022
